definition: Dharma, the teaching of Buddha/Bodhidharma
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
to rub
Bodhidharma

sentences.english: Meditating without food does not prove that he is reincarnation of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 能冥想而不禁食不能证明他是达摩转世。

sentences.english: SEE Sword of Damocles Subforum for more information.
sentences.chinese: 进入达摩克利斯之剑的子论坛获取更多信息。

sentences.english: That's Gotama the contemplative, sitting surrounded by a large assembly, teaching the Dhamma.
sentences.chinese: 那是沙门乔达摩为众人围绕，正端坐说法。

sentences.english: Bodhidharma channel-changing Scripture is one of the earliest exercise method that were practiced by Shaolin Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: 达摩易筋经是少林寺众僧演练的最早功法之一。

sentences.english: The cave is now called Damo Cave.
sentences.chinese: 这个洞穴是现在被称为达摩洞。

sentences.english: So what does Damodaran think Alibaba's share should be worth?
sentences.chinese: 那么，达摩达兰认为阿里巴巴的股票价值几何呢？

sentences.english: This has been a general discussion of Patriarch Bodhidharma's life in China.
sentences.chinese: 这是达摩祖师一生到中国的大概经过。

sentences.english: These bills now hang over people like the Sword of Damocles.
sentences.chinese: 现在这些债务就像达摩克利斯之剑一样悬在人们头上。

sentences.english: A-3. None of the judges realized that they had this sword of Damocles hanging over them.
sentences.chinese: 没有一位法官认识到这把达摩利剑正悬在他们的头上。

sentences.english: and her earrings dangle like Damocles' sword.
sentences.chinese: 她的耳环危悬如达摩克利斯之剑。

sentences.english: The sea is now a sword of Damocles over the head of the Japanese people.
sentences.chinese: 海正一把达摩克利斯剑头上的日本人。

sentences.english: Damocles looked up and saw that the sword when alarmed.
sentences.chinese: 达摩克利斯抬头望见这把利剑时，大惊失色。

sentences.english: Night smell before came to DaMaDong kneeling begged the master save copper people outside the hole.
sentences.chinese: 晚上闻道来到达摩洞前，跪在洞外祈求大师救铜人们。

sentences.english: Vajrayana thus attempts to recapture the enlightenment experience of the gautama buddha .
sentences.chinese: 从而金刚乘是尝试去再体验乔达摩佛的启迪体验。

sentences.english: It is Damo, an Indian monk, who introduced the traditional Dhyana in India into China.
sentences.chinese: 印度僧人达摩东渡来华，带来了印度传统的禅法。

sentences.english: More than sixty years passed; for three years Bodhidharma drifted across the ocean until he arrived in China.
sentences.chinese: 六十多年之后，达摩远泛重洋，经过三年，达到中国。

definition: Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
armor
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil

Jiang Ziya (c. 1100 BC, dates of birth and death unknown), partly mythical sage advisor to King Wen of Zhou 周文王[Zhou1 Wen2 wang2] and purported author of “Six Secret Strategic Teachings” 六韜|六韬[Liu4 tao1], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Miyamoto (Japanese surname)
Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry
Hua Mulan, legendary woman warrior (c. fifth century), Northern dynasties folk hero recorded in Sui and Tang literature

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Nezha, protection deity
same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
